formulas.raw: Monthly payment (amortizing loan): \( \mathrm{PMT}=\dfrac{P \cdot i}{1-(1+i)^{-n}} \) where \( P \) is amount financed, \( i=\text{APR}/12 \), \( n \) is months. For APR \( =0 \): \( \mathrm{PMT}=P/n \). Amount financed with taxes and fees: \( P=(\text{Price}-\text{Down}-\text{TradeIn})+\text{Fees}+\text{Tax}_{\text{sales}} \).
